page.title: 11Royston Museum
page.content: Royston museum is a new feature of Royston. It opened last year. The building is in Kneesworth Street and used to be a Sunday School.The museum is open to the public on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and to school parties on Thursdays. Inside the museum there are all sorts of things about the history of Royston. Upstairs there are rooms for exhibitions and there is a balcony with benches that run right round the inside .Little children used to sit up here during Sunday school.In the museum there are lots of very old things.There is an organ which still works. There are quite a few old carts, a sewing machine, a printing press and lots of old advertising signs.There used to be 42 inns in Royston ( now there are only 8) Some of the inn signs are on display. There are pictures of the first cars.
